metadata.title: CVE-2021-42771 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Babel.Locale in Babel before 2.9.1 allows attackers to load arbitrary locale .dat files (containing serialized Python objects) via directory traversal, leading to code execution.

notes.note: leosilva> fixed as CVE-2021-20095. But that CVE number was rejected and that new one was assigned to that issue.

criterions.comment: python-babel package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.0+dfsg.1-6ubuntu0.1').
